text: One of those anonymous trucker motels along-side I-5 thro central California. It’s late summer, 2002. Two women sle together in a bed. Christine, aka Lady Bird, 17 years old Her Mom, Marion, the age of Lady Bird’s Mom. A modern-day romantic Mary Cassatt rip-off painting of motherhood.
Do you think I look like I’m from Sacramento?
Now they’re awake. Lady Bird stares at her re. Marion mak the bed.
You are from Sacramento.
(re: making the bed) You don’t have to do that.

Well it’s nice to make things neat and clean. Marion is making hospital corners. Lady Bird sits on the just made bed. Marion sits beside her, moves the hair out Lady Bird’s eyes. MARION (CONT’D) Ready to go home?
Ready. INT. 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. CALIFORNIA. DAY. The last sentences of The Grapes of Wrath.

“Her hand moved behind his head and supported it. Her fingers moved gently in his hair. She looked up and across the barn, and her lips came together and smiled mysteriously.” You have been listening to ‘The Grapes of Wrath’ by John Steinbeck. If you... (pause) Lady Bird ejects the tape, returns it to the case fromth public library. They are both crying.

(looking on the back) Our college trip took 21 hours and 5 minutes. They laugh and then wipe their tears. It’s a nice moment they both had the same emotion. Lady Bird immediately sta looking for a good song on the radio.
(turning it off) Hey, you know, let’s just sit with what we heard?
(bristling) Are you serious?
We don’t need to be constantly entertaining ourselves, do we? Lady Bird stares out the window, now sullen. Then:
I wish I could live through something.
Aren’t you?
Nope. The only exciting thing about 2002 is that it’s a palindrome.
Ok fine, yours is the worst life of all, you win.
Oh so now you’re mad? Because It’s just that you’re being I wanted to listen to music? ridiculous, you have a great life.
I’m sorry I’m not perfect.
Nobody is asking you to be perfect! Just considerate would do.
(really picking a fight) I don’t even want to go to school in this state anyway, I hate California. I want to go to the East Coast.
Your Dad and I will barely be able to afford in-state tuition.
There are loans, scholarships!
Your brother, your very smart brother, can’t even find a job --
He and Shelly work. They have jobs.

head_text.subj: THEY BAG AT THE GROCERY STORE.

text: That is not a career and they went to BERKELEY .MARION Your father’s company is laying people off right and left you know that? No of course not because you don’t care ab anyone but yourself.
Immaculate Heart is already a luxury.
Immaculate FART. You wanted that, not me!
Miguel saw someone knifed in front of him at Sac High, is that what you want? You’re telling me that you want to see someone knifed right in front of you?
He barely saw that. I want to go where culture is, like New York.
How in the world did I raise Or at least Connecticut or such a SNOB? New Hampshire. Where writers live in the woods.
You couldn’t get into those schools anyway.
You can’t even pass your driver’s test.
Because you wouldn’t let me practice enough!
The way you work, the way you don’t work, you’re not even worth state tuition, Christine.
MY NAME IS LADY BIRD! Well actually, it’s not, and it’s ridiculous. Your name is Christine.

head_text.subj: CALL ME LADY BIRD LIKE YOU SAID YOU

text: You should just go to City College, with your work ethic. City College and then to jail then back to City College. Maybe you’d learn how to pull yourself up and not expect everyone to do everything for you... They slow for a stop light and Lady Bird dramatically ope the door and rolls out of the car. Marion screams.  INT. IMMACULATE HEART OF MARY. DAY. Close on a cast. In very small letters is written “fuck y mom.” The cast belongs to Lady Bird. She follows along wi the mass. CREDITS run over this joint liturgy between Immaculate He of Mary (girls school) and Xavier (boys school) and begin of the year activities. A sea of catholic girls’ school uniforms in bleachers dur candidate speeches.

(finishing her speech) A Vote for Amanda is a vote for boys. Boys and healthy vending machines because no one wants a muffin with that many calories. Lady Bird waits her turn to make her speech, and makes ey contact with Julie in the crowd, a sweet, chubby 17 year Her best friend. 5 classrooms, 5 syllabi, 5 “beginning of senior year” speeches from the teachers. A few teachers are nuns.

There are the classics: St. Augustine, of course, and Aquinas. My favorite, Kierkegaard - wait until you hear his love story - it will make you swoon. Back in the church, Lady Bird looks intently at an image Jesus. The priest gives his homily.

We’re afraid we won’t get into the college of our choice, we’re afraid we won’t be loved, we won’t be liked, we won’t succeed. Everyone takes communion. Lady Bird approaches and crosse her arms so she just gets a blessing, not real communion, she’s not Catholic. Lady Bird watches the boys get commun It’s somehow sexy, opening their mouths to receive the wa
Some of the students were disturbed by your posters.  INT. VICE-PRINCIPAL SISTER SARAH-JOAN’S OFFICE. DAY. Sister Sarah-Joan, in a traditional habit, holds up some Lady Bird’s campaign materials.
It’s just a bird head on a lady body or vice versa.
I think it’s a little upsetting... Reveal of the poster: Lady Bird’s head on a bird body. Another shows her Catholic-uniformed body with a bird hea
It’s my tradition to run for office. Don’t worry, I won’t win.
That’s not what I’m worried about.
(worried) This won’t mess with my scholarship, will it?
No, you’re okay there. (trying to be helpful) You have a performative streak, I think.
I think that too.
Maybe you’d enjoy theatre arts... They are having auditions for the fall musical.
Do we have that here?
It’s a collaborative effort with the men at Xavier.
How am I a senior and not know we have that?
Perhaps you haven’t always been an active part of this community.
They do a fall musical and a spring play and from what I hear it’s a real blast.
What I’d really like is to be on Math Olympiad.
(gently) But math isn’t something that you are terribly strong in?

That we know of YET. CLOSE ON A LIST. Sign ups for auditions for the fall musical. A hand reach up and takes the pen attached and writes, in all caps: CHRISTINE “LADY BIRD” McPHERSON And then another hand reaches up and writes: JULIANNE “JULIE” PICKETT
“Julie” doesn’t need to be in quotes.
But it’s not my real name. Reveal Julie and Lady Bird debating this:
It’s not the same thing.

(shaking her head) I’m not sure you’re right...  EXT. SACRAMENTO STREETS. LATE AFTERNOON. Julie and Lady Bird walk through the “fancy” neighborhood “The Fabulous Forties.” They stop in front of this very specific house - it is the Dream House: It is three stori and blue, with white shutters and a big American Flag. It looks like nothing bad would ever happen in this house.
I love this neighborhood.
Yeah, it’s so beautiful.
If I lived here I would definitely have my wedding in the backyard.
I’d have friends over all the time to study and eat snacks. I’d be like “MOM WE’RE TAKING THE SNACKS UPSTAIRS TO THE TV ROOM.”
I’d have my own bathroom. INT. GROCERY STORE. EARLY EVENING. Julie and Lady Bird browse magazines in an empty checkout aisle. A Checker calls out to them:
I can’t stop you dicks from hanging out here but quit wrinkling all the magazines!

When I’m in this store, I’m not your sister - I’m a customer, Miguel! I’m always right! This is Miguel. Lady Bird’s brother. 22, Latino, clearly adopted. Julie watches him and his girlfriend, Shelly Yuh 22, a Bagger:
Ever since she moved in, your brother and Shelly are becoming the same person.

No way. Shelly and Miguel have the same asymmetrical hair-cut an “interesting” piercings. Vaguely punk looking. Seem like they’ re wearing black leather jackets even when they are LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Yeah, okay, maybe.
(re: magazine) See, why I don’t look like that? The girls look at a model in the magazine. She poses in front of the New York City skyline.
Just once I’d like to have the song “New York Groove” play and feel like it really applies to my life.
You’ve never even been to New York.
That’s why I’m applying to New York colleges - do you know if Sarah Lawrence is actually IN the city?
Your parents would pay for that?
Scholarships, financial aid. I’1l figure it out. My Mom thinks I can’t get in but she is sorely mistaken.
What about terrorism?
Don’t be a Republican.
I’m probably just going to go to City College.
(almost yelling) PUT THE MAGAZINE BACK.SHIT. INT. PSYCH HOSPITAL. EARLY MORNING. Marion yawns. Luis, a large Filipino man, approaches her:  10.
You doing okay, mama?
Yes, but that was terrifying wasn’t it? Thank god you were there. I guess I can’t have pencils anymore.
Yeah, gotta go back to just felt tip markers. Crayola. Marion suddenly remembers she has something, she hand Lui small bag:
Oh Luis this is for you! I got it for the baby, I couldn’t resist it. He pulls out a frilly pink dress for a toddler.
She loves pink!
Well, it’s really more for you and Andrea than it is for the baby, and I’m sorry I didn’t have time to wrap it....
No, it’s perfect.

See you tomorrow... I mean, later? Luis just laughs. INT. 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. EARLY MORNING. Marion drives back home. It is romantic somehow. She love these streets, loves the turns she knows so well. When sh not resenting the stuck-ness of her own life she has an enormous capacity to love it. Remember this moment with Marion. EXT. LADY BIRD’S NEIGHBORHOOD. EARLY MORNING. Marion drives up. Women are watering their lawns, getting paper, doing yard work, touching their flowers. Solidly middle class. Marion waves to neighbors. They wave back. picks up the mail, bills, papers, etc.  11. INT. BATHROOM. MORNING. Dad (50s, name: Larry) brushes his teeth. Marion perched the edge of the tub with a newspaper and a stack of mail, going through it.
Did you know toothpaste is basically ineffective? It’s like sucking on a mint.
(to Larry, shaking her head) Mike Kerry died. I didn’t know he was sick again.
How old was he?
Only fifty-six. Knocking at the door.
Can Shelly and I get in there?
In a minute honey Dad and I are still in here!
(re: Mike) That’s too young.
(calling)

head_text.subj: LADY BIRD YOU BETTER BE DRESSED

text: MARION (CONT’D) I’11 send them a note. (a little softer) Do you think that Shelly and Miguel have sex on the pullout couch?  12.

Oh yeah. Marion laughs at Larry’s subtle joke. He laughs at her laughter. They like each other. INT. KITCHEN. MORNING. Miguel and Shelly eat cereal. Larry reads the paper. Mari makes Lady Bird’s breakfast and her lunch.
Why can’t I just make the eggs?
Because you take too long and make a big mess and then I have to clean it up.
(small voice) Eggs aren’t good for the environment, anyway.
(too loud)
You heard her.
(placing the eggs) Here, eat quickly, PLEASE.
(re: paper) Look at all these pictures. Every newspaper looks like USA Today.
Shelly and I are trying to be vegan. Hence the soy milk.
You wear leather jackets.  13.
They’ re vintage. It doesn’t support the industry.
(poking at the eggs) They aren’t done, there’s white stuff.
You know how you love Brambles? Pigs are smarter than him even.
I never thought Brambles was a GENIUS okay? LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (very obnoxious) MOM! The eggs are NOT DONE!

head_text.subj: FINE MAKE YOUR OWN FUCKING EGGS.

text: Marion then throws the frying pan violently in the sink a retreats to the bathroom. The noisy hair-dryer starts up.
I WANTED TO YOU WON’T LET ME! Lady Bird follows Marion out of the room.
Your sister doesn’t like me.
MOM!!! I’M HUNGRY!
She does. Shelly gets up, pouting. MIGUEL follows her
Larry is left alone. It’s weirdly peaceful for half a sec 1994 TOYOTA COROLLA. DAY. Lady Bird and Larry on the way to school. She feverishly changes the radio station, finds a song she likes:
Did you know that Alanis Morisette wrote this song in only ten minutes? —
I believe it.
(she smiles) So I’m applying to a couple East Coast schools. I need you to help me with the financial aid application but Mom can’t know.
We... aren’t they quite expensive?
First, yes that’s why financial aid. Second, I have to get in first.
Mom won’t be happy about it.
Which is why I don’t want to fight about it before I have to.  15. Lady Bird looks up. They are a couple of blocks from scho LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Just pull over here
Are you sure, I can drive you to the front --
No, just this is fine. I like to walk.
Okay, well, I love you.
So what do you think? About college?
I’1l1 see what I can do.
(kisses him on the cheek Thanks Dad, love you too. Have a good day at work.
Hey, I’m like Keith Richards “I’m just happy to be anywhere.” She gets out quickly and hurries away. She’s almost at sc when Julie pulls up.
(calling out) Hey bitch! Ms. Pickett has VERY LARGE fake breasts. Her boyfriend, M hands a sack lunch to Lady Bird and Julie.
Alright girls, hope you like pickles.  16.
Thanks, Uncle Matt.
Sweet! Ms. Pickett gets in the driver’s seat, they drive away.
He’s not your uncle.
It’s something I’m trying out. Bye, mom. (watching Ms. Pickett go) Your Mom really likes you.

Yeah. I just keep getting fatter. Lady Bird starts eating the Matt lunch and chucks her own lunch into a garbage can. The one her Mom spent time maki LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (mouth full) Me too. Matt is awesome.

Yeah, I hope he marries my Mom. That would be nice. He promised me his old car when I turn eighteen. In the student parking lot, a girl gets out of her fancy Range Rover. She’s pretty in a high school way.
That car should be illegal. Jenna Walton’s not doing any off-roading. She just goes to Pavillions.
I heard Jenna Walton has a tanning bed in her house. The girl, Jenna Walton, is very tan. Identical tan girls descend on her.
She is so pretty.
Her skin is luminous.
Maybe we should try tanning.  17.
Lady Bird and Julie sit with their legs up the wall, eati communion wafers out of a large plastic container.

Yeah, in the tub I just scoot myself under like now, like this, and then the water just... She gestures, showing that the water would flow into her crotch and get her off. They are hysterically laughing.
We are so gross!
I think I figured it out when I was like three or something.
I use, I take off the shower head, oh god this is so embarrassing! I use that.
I don’t know if mine is the right kind, though. Maybe it’s different when you actually have a penis in there, like it’s more intense.
Mine is pretty intense, I think. Darlene, an odd looking girl, has silently walked in.
You’ re not supposed to eat the wafers!

(trying to be helpful) They aren’t consecrated. Darlene turns on her heel, annoyed. Lady Bird and Julie dissolve into giggles. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. DAY. Lady Bird, wearing an extreme “audition” dress, and Julie her uniform, sit and watch other students perform.  18. Father Leviatch runs auditions - there is something funny depressed about him. An overweight woman, Miss Patty, accompanies on the piano when needed. A boy, Greg, is up. He has a big voice for such a tinyboy
“BEING ALIVVEEEEEEEEEE...... 17 Cut to Father Leviatch calling out from his clipboard:
Okay, Christine?
Lady Bird.
Is that your given name?
Yes.
Why is it in quotes?
Well I gave it to myself. It’s given. To me, by me.
OK, take it away, Lady Bird. Cut to Lady Bird singing her song.

“Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t it isn’t right, don’t it isn’t niiiiiceeee / Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t / Everybody says don’t walk on the grass....” Cut to Julie, wearing her uniform, shy and nervous:

(singing) “Make me a channel of your peace / where there’s despair in life let me bring hope / where there is darkness only light / and where there’s sadness ever joy....” Julie has a sweet, clear, beautiful voice. It’s a quiet moment and everyone pays attention.  19. More girls and more boys. Now most everyone is done. Danny stands. He’s very handsome. Strapping, even. He giv his sheet music to the Miss Patty. Then he sings:

(singing) “There are giants in the sky! / There are big tall terrible giants in the sky! When you’re way up high and you look below at the world you’ve left and the things you know little than a glance is enough to show you just how small you are!” He’s AMAZING. Julie and Lady Bird look at each other. DRE BOAT CITY. INT. LADY BIRD’S ROOM. NIGHT. Underneath her window sill by her bed, Lady Bird writes t name: DANNY. She’s in love and want to make it permanent somewhere. Suddenly, a voice is directed right at Lady Bird’s door:

head_text.subj: I CAN SEE THE LIGHT ON IN YOUR ROOM

text: Lady Bird shuts off her light and sleeps, dreaming of Dan
Lady Bird and Julie check the casting list. They first fi
Franklin Shepard: Danny O’Neill, Charlie Kringus: Greg An Gussie: Diana Greenway, Beth: Julie Steffans. They move way down the list until they find: Swing/Chorus: Christine McPherson
(tightly) Congratulations.
You too! We both got in!  20.
Everyone who auditioned got in. The part I got was basically not getting in.
(trying to downplay) I do not even know how I got cast in my part.
Me neither. I was the one who had a dress and prepared a song.
I know!
(thinking) Now you're going to get romantic with Danny on stage.
It’s probably my only shot at that, you know?

She take the pen and crosses out Christine and writes LAD BIRD. Leaves. Julie stays and when she’s sure she’s alone she touches h name - loving herself and the feeling of being chosen. INT. GROCERY STORE. EARLY EVENING. Marion grocery shops. Lady Bird looks at a BRIDE magazine
Mom...
(re: the magazine) We don’t need to buy that.
It’s only three dollars. I’m having a hard week.
If you want to read it we can goto the public library.
I want to read it in bed.  21.

That’s something rich people do. We are not rich people. Lady Bird walks away and then tucks the magazine undernea her sweater into the top of her skirt, sneakily stealing As she’s performing this maneuver, she sees DANNY (!) and Mom and three little brothers walk by. She walks up brave
Hey!
Hi.
Come here often?
(not getting the joke) Excuse me?
(extending her hand) I’m Lady Bird, we’re going to be in the musical together.
Oh, yeah, I remember you! You were wearing that dress.
I just wanted to say what’s up and I’ll see you in rehearsal.
Thanks, I’m super excited. You live in the neighborhood?
(doing a voice) Nah, I’m from the wrong side of the tracks.
What?
Is that your family? There are so many of you!
Irish-Catholic! It’s hard to finda girl to date that’s not my cousin.  22.
(flustered) Well, okay. You’re going to make a great Franklin.
Thanks! I want my hair, his hair to be curly, though.
Yeah!
Like Jim Morrison. Very ‘70s.
Like Jim Morrison exactly. DANNY’ S MOM
Gotta go! Lady Bird walks back to Marion, who is with Miguel while scans their groceries and Shelly bags them.
Who is Jim Morrison again?
He was in a rock band, moron, The Doors.
I knew that.
(looking at the bill This is with your employee discount?

Yeah, it’s already included. Marion looks worried. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. AFTERNOON. Everyone tries to keep up with the dance steps Miss Patty teaches them. She is also, apparently, the choreographer. can move amazingly well for a bigger woman.  23. They play theatre games and do acting exercises. Father Leviatch is actually quite good at casting a spell and ma everyone feel included.
The priest, Father Leviatch, looks around the stage where everyone sits, cross legged, tired from dancing.
To get our emotions going, we’re going to play “first one to cry wins.”

Starting ... Now. I’m playing too. So is Miss Patty. Miss Patty nods. They all try to cry really hard. Suddenly everyone looks - Father Leviatch is sobbing. Everyone is uncomfortable watching an adult man cry.
I’m sorry.. I’m sorry. EXT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. AFTERNOON. Diana, another girl in the play, dishes the gossip while and Lady Bird and Danny wait for their rides:

I heard that before he became a priest he was married and he had a son named Etienne who died of a drug overdose at 17 which was maybe a suicide but my mom says same difference if you are so careless with your life. (a horn honks) Oh that’s her! Gotta go, bye guys! Lady Bird and Danny wave goodbye and then fall into a semi- awkward silence. She sees it’s her Moment. She trie to casually hand Danny a bag but it’s a kind of big bag.  24.
Oh, I almost forgot. I brought you these hot rollers. For your Jim Morrison hair. He pulls out the Conair pink and purple “Hot Sticks.”
Thank you so much.
You’ re welcome.
You’11 have to show me how to use them.
(weirdly formal) It would be my pleasure.
They look like sperms. He laughs and Lady Bird joins in. They do look like sperm but it wasn’t so funny to say it. DANNY (CONT’D) Hey! I just remembered I had a dream about you!
Really?! What happened?
We were flying to Disneyland on a giant carrot....
Awesome!
I love Disneyland.
Me too, I think it’s kind of scary but I also love it. Triumph! They are having a Real Conversation.

Mr. Bruno explains a problem on a projector. He’s handsom and young-ish. Definitely handsome for an all girls schoo Lady Bird zones out, thinking about Danny. Julie looks intently at Mr. Bruno. She loves him, privately.  25.
(finishing an explanation) Don’t leave me hanging. Can I get a nod? That’s good. Maybe even a verbal confirmation?
(too loud) YES. Julie experience her mini moment of private embarrassment They are handed back quizzes. Julie gets a A-.
Good job, Jules, I could tell from your work that you even understood the one you missed! He kind of winks at her. She blushes.
(looking at her grade) SUCK A DICK.
(to Lady Bird) I like “Jules.” Lady Bird looks at her C+.
I just don’t get why I’m not good at math, my Dad is really good at math. Even Miguel has a math degree.

Maybe it’s your Mom’s fault. INT. HOMECOMING DANCE. SCHOOL GYM. NIGHT. There are a bunch of kids clumped, some dancing, some sit on half-hearted hay bales. The popular girls, Jenna etc., wear tank tops that say (front) Ditch the horse... (and b Ride the cowboy! Lady Bird and Julie now have on bandanas and denim - they doing the Groucho Marx Duck Soup dance to “Tha Crossroads Suddenly Lady Bird stops.
You lose! POINT JULIE!
No, look  26. Across the dance, there is Danny. He’s wearing chaps, a h a hat, fake pistols. Like teenage John Wayne. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) Wish me luck.
Luck. Julie watches as Lady Bird makes a bee-line for Danny.
Wanna dance?

Hell, yeah! They start slow dancing together. Julie does the duck-sou dance alone and then stops. It’s pointless without a budd She falls back and watches. Sister Sarah-Joan walks by Lady Bird and Danny:

Six inches for the Holy Spirit! They roll their eyes: Rules! Once she leaves Danny pulls Bird close again. She swoons. Life is happening. EXT. SCHOOL GYM. NIGHT. Lady Bird, Julie and Danny wait outside of the dance, lea against the gym waiting for their parents. Julie’s Mom pu up with Uncle Matt. Honks.
(to Lady Bird) That’s us!
Nah, my Mom is coming.
No she’s not.
(pointed) Yes, she is.
But the plan was sleepover at -
IT’S FINE.  27. Lady Bird is clearly trying to stay there with Danny.
(annoyed) Okay, bye then. Julie gets in the front seat to practice driving. Leaves. Lady Bird and Danny are quiet, listening to the muffled sounds of the dance. Then:
Have you ever been out of the country?
When I was little, my Dad had a job that took him to Brazil. I remember from the pictures.
I’ve never been out of the country. It’s my dream to go to Paris.
(sighs) Paris.
That’s why I’m learning French.
My mom said French wasn’t useful.
It is if you want to go to Paris. They laugh. DANNY (CONT’D) I still don’t know how to use those rollers you gave me.

Oh, it’s so easy, like after they heat up, you just take your hair and twist the hair and then twirl the thing like this... She reaches up to his hair. He kisses her. It’s surprisin They kiss again. It’s romantic, really romantic. EXT. SACRAMENTO STREETS. NIGHT. Lady Bird walks home. She’s smiling so huge and throws he face to the sky and screams. INT. HOUSE. NIGHT.  Marion and Larry are arguing with a lot of financial documents strewn across the kitchen table. 28.  29.
Larry how long will this hold us.
I don’t know... Lady Bird opens the back door, glowing and shiny from the night and the kiss. She sneaks past.
Well, someone must know. Can the whole family go on Cobra, even Miguel? What happens if someone gets in an accident?

I’m not sure - the severance package I think it expires all at once, not within the calendar year... Lady Bird tip-toes into her room. She knows she wasn’t supposed to see this. And she doesn’t want to know any mo
I’ll ask at my work if -- Suddenly, a noise makes her turn her head sharply. MARION (CONT’D) Is she home?
Maybe leave it for tonight...

No, she knows better. (getting up) She cannot sneak around like this... Marion barrels down the hallway towards Lady Bird’s room. INT. BEDROOM. NIGHT. Lady-Bird, under the covers, hears her Mom coming. Then a the lights come on, it’s so bright:
Christine! You can’t leave your room like this!
I didn’t...  30.
None of these things were put away right, they aren’t nice,
(weakly) My name is Lady Bird.
Don’t lie to me, Christine! Lady Bird sees her Dad pass by the door and give her a lo like “I’m sorry, I can’t help you here.” He disappears. Marion picks up her uniform.
NO, this uniform is going to look like TRASH on Monday! MARION (CONT’D) This isn’t right - we can’t treat our clothes like this. I don’t know what your wealthy friends do...
Why do you care what I do tomy clothes? Marion closes the door..
Your father does not have a job.
He lost his job, okay? Do you need him to come in here and explain that to you?  Lady Bird Lady Bird 30.
Of course he wouldn’t do it anyway, he’s Mr. Nice Guy. I always have to be the Bad Guy.
Can we please talk about this tomorrow?

You can’t look like a rag because that makes us look like rags. And you want to know the truth? Here’s the truth: some of your friends’ fathers could employ your father and they won’t do that if it looks like his family is trash. puts all her clothes away while Marion watches.
(quietly) Didn’t you ever go to sleep without putting all your clothes away perfectly? Like even once? And don’t you wish your Mom hadn’t gotten angry?

My mother was an abusive alcoholic. has nothing to say to this, Marion wins. INT. GUIDANCE COUNSELOR’S OFFICE. DAY. Lady Bird looks at some brochures. The Guidance Counselor looks at her grades and test scores.
So I understand that you’re not interested in any Catholic colleges?
No way. Sorry, but yes, no way.  31.
Then you’1l be applying to UCs and State schools?
Yes, but also those East Coast liberal arts schools. Like Yale, but not Yale because I probably couldn’t get in.
(laughs) You definitely couldn’t get in. Part of my job is to help yoube realistic.
That seems like everyone’s job.

Your SAT scores are strangely very good. Lady Bird shrugs. GUIDANCE COUNSELOR (CONT’D) I’d placed some calls to local alumni of the schools you’re interested in, but unfortunately all the interviews are taken.
So... what does that mean?

It means that you’ll have to get in on how you look on paper. INT. THEATRE. DAY. The kids rehearse -- following dance moves and singing. EXT. ROSE GARDEN. NIGHT. Lady Bird and Danny lie on a blanket in the park, looking at the stars.
Shouldn’t we go home?
(shakes her head) My Mom is always mad. It doesn’t matter if I get home late, she’d be mad at me anyway.
Your Mom is hard on you.
(defensively) She loves me a lot. (then) Pick a star for us.
(pointing) That one, right there right next to the bright one and then the dim one - see it?
That’s our star. LADY BIRD (CONT’D) (whispering) You know you can touch my boobs, right?
I know... it’s just.... I respect you too much for that.
Oh, cool, awesome. I totally get that. Thank you.
You're welcome.  33.
If you had boobs I wouldn’t touch them either.
I respect you so much because... I love you.

Bye, love you. Julie takes off. Lady Bird lazily walks the halls. She sees her empty math classroom and sees that Mr. Bruno isn’t there. She ducks inside. Notices his grade binder o the desk. Snatches it and then runs. She dumps it into one of the big trash cans and hurries a  35. INT. THRIFT TOWN. DAY. Marion and Lady Bird are looking through dresses.
Did Danny say whether his grandmother has a formal Thanksgiving?

(nodding) Your dad and I went to a dinner party once in that neighborhood, the CEO of ISC, and it was pretty formal. Lady Bird finds something - holds up a black dress. They keep MARION (CONT’D) You’re not going to a funeral.
Well, I don’t know! What says “rich people Thanksgiving”? looking.
It’s just such a shame that you’re spending your last Thanksgiving with a family you’ve never met instead of us, but I guess you want it that way. (clocks her walking) Are you tired?
No. A saleswoman, Joyce, calls out:
Hey Marion! Marion waves to the saleswoman. Her voice is so warm and friendly with other people who are not her daughter:

He’s crawling!

You are so INFURIATING.
Please stop yelling.

Don’t you love it.  37. INT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. LATE AT NIGHT. Marion, still in her nurses uniform, sits at the sewing machine, tailoring the dress she and Lady Bird found. She finishes, and then hangs it up quietly in Lady Bird’s roo Doesn’t wake her up, simply watches her daughter sleep fo minute. INT. ALGEBRA II CLASS. DAY. Mr. Bruno addresses his class: MR. Bruno So because my gradebook has disappeared, I am going to count on you to reconstruct it. I know you all know your grades better than anybody. MR. Bruno I’m pretty sure it was an A.
Um, I’m not but okay... MR. Bruno It was - trust me, I know talent when I see it.
You’ re welcome. No, thank you. He does that wink thing at her again. She retreats, red faced. Lady Bird is next:
Hey, I think B. MR. Bruno I thought it was more like B- maybe even C+ territory.
No, because I did really well on the last quiz...  38. MR. Bruno I seem to remember you doing only slightly better.

It brought my average up to aB. MR. Bruno Okay, B it is. It’s your honor. INT. LADY BIRD’S HOUSE. DAY. Marion, Larry, Shelly and Miguel run around making sure t house is perfect for their Thanksgiving. The doorbell rin

Hello, Danny! The famous Danny! Aren’t you adorable! (she hugs him) Larry isn’t he adorable?
He’s adorable.
And you're driving her and everything - Wow!

(firmly shaking Larry’s hand) Nice to meet you, Mr. McPherson.
Please, call me Mr. Larry McPherson.  39.
(hits him) Larry! Sit down Danny, can I get you something to drink?

Is my name. They’re quiet for a moment. Danny tries to converse:
It’s funny, on my way here, I went over the train tracks --

Ah.

My grandmother will love that dress. INT. DANNY’S GRANDMOTHER’S HOUSE. LATE AFTERNOON. Thanksgiving. It is at the Dream House. From the beginnin The blue one with the white trim and the American Flag. L Bird cannot believe it.

Sarah-Joan is all up in my jock.

Lady Bird.

Alright let’s have everyone take a knee. Confusion. Miss Patty won’t make eye contact with them
Cozy sit.

So I know that you all miss Father Leviatch, all of the brothers do too, but I am going to give this my very best shot, okay? Usually I’m the J.V. football coach, but from what I can tell a “play” is a “play.” No real response. Danny sits with Julie, whispers:

I had Miss Patty assign parts because she already knows you all. Miss Patty nods. FATHER WALTHER (CONT’D) Call ‘em out Miss Patty! Miss Patty starts:  54.

(lying, again) Um, 44th it’s, um, it’s the three story blue house with the white shutters and the American flag in the front. She describes the house that she and Julie lusted after l fall, Danny’s Grandmother’s house.
I know that one! Wanna go over there now and eat? I live in Granite Bay otherwise I’d say lets go there.
Um, actually, I was thinking - maybe we should go to the Deuce? (trying to be casual) I was talking to Kyle about it and he was like “whatever it’s lame but maybe I’1l see you there.”
How do you know Kyle?  55.
My Mom made me get a job at New Helvetia to learn “responsibility” Anyway we hang out there.

Yeah, Kyle’s awesome. let’s Deuce it up. INT. XAVIER MULTI-PURPOSE ROOM/THEATRE. DAY. Father Walther is writing all the blocking on the blackbo like the football coach he is. All the students are frantically taking down the notes in their scripts. EXT. SIERRA II. “THE DEUCE.” PARKING LOT. DAY. Jenna joins Jonah & co in the parking lot, drinking and smoking. This is the Deuce? It’s a parking lot? We were in one parking lot and we went to another parking lot.
(calling out) KYLE! Lady Bird and I just decorated the nun-mobile like “just married to Jesus!

Don’t worry, I’m not gonna snitch on you.

Before they put them in our brains. Lady Bird laughs and then stops herself. He is dead fucki serious. She wants to touch him again but can’t invent a reason why. INT. NEW HELVETIA COFFEE SHOP.
